item.title: 原油上涨，中东风险和中国成为焦点
item.description: 在周二下跌超过4%之后，石油价格攀升，因为以色列表示将自行决定如何攻击伊朗，并保留了能源基础设施可能成为攻击目标的可能性。【原文：Oil climbed — after slumping by more than 4% on Tuesday — as Israel said it would make its own decision on how to attack Iran, keeping open the possibility that energy infrastructure may be targeted.】

item.title: 美容诊所为日本创始人带来 7 亿美元财富
item.description: 最近在美国首次亮相的最有价值的日本公司之一，是一家提供整形手术、激光祛斑和吸脂的连锁诊所。由于这笔交易，这家公司 54 岁的创始人相川义行（Yoshiyuki Aikawa）如今身价约 7 亿美元。【原文：One of the most valuable Japanese companies to debut in the US recently is a chain of clinics offering plastic surgery, laser spot removal and liposuction. Thanks to that deal, its 54-year-old founder Yoshiyuki Aikawa — who started out two decades ago printing and delivering brochures by hand — is now worth around $700 million.】

item.title: Rightmove 称，英国房东出售房屋的速度创下历史新高
item.description: 由于担心更严格的绿色规则和即将到来的预算案中更高的税收前景，英国买房出租的房东正在创纪录地抛售房产，这给租户带来了更大的压力。【原文：UK buy-to-let landlords are selling up in record numbers due to worries about stricter green rules and the prospect of higher taxes in the upcoming budget, piling further pressure on tenants.】

item.title: 科技股下滑，亚洲股市追随美国股市跌势：市场综述
item.description: 在欧洲最有价值的科技公司的前景令人失望，以及对美国收紧芯片销售限制的担忧打击了这个推动牛市的行业之后，亚洲股市将跟随美国股市下挫。【原文：Stocks in Asia are poised to follow a US selloff after a disappointing outlook from Europe’s most-valuable tech firm and concern about tighter US curbs on chip sales hit the industry that’s powered the bull market.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行警惕通胀预期减弱迹象
item.description: 澳大利亚央行行长助理萨拉-亨特（Sarah Hunter）表示，澳大利亚央行时刻警惕通货膨胀预期在当前物价高企的情况下可能变得不稳定的迹象，尽管央行有信心在短期内控制通货膨胀预期。【原文：Australia’s central bank is on constant alert for signs that inflation expectations may become unmoored in the current episode of elevated and sticky prices, though it’s confident they’re contained in the near-term, Assistant Governor Sarah Hunter said.】

item.title: 习近平加强对立法机构的控制显示权力缺乏制约
item.description: 当全世界都在等待中国的立法者为财政刺激政策标价时，有一点越来越清楚：他们所做的一切都将反映出习近平主席对政府和社会各方面日益增强的控制力。【原文：As the world waits for China’s lawmakers to put a price tag on fiscal stimulus, one thing is increasingly clear: Anything they produce will reflect the growing control of President Xi Jinping over all aspects of government and society.】

item.title: 被法官称为 "意外间谍 "的前银行家被判无期徒刑
item.description: 一名 Capital One Financial Corp. 的前银行家在被法官定性为埃及的 "意外间谍 "后，没有被判入狱。【原文：A former Capital One Financial Corp. banker was given no jail time after a judge characterized him as a sort of “accidental spy” for Egypt.】

item.title: 芝加哥学校闹剧让信用评估师警惕风险
item.description: 芝加哥教育局领导层的突然更迭引起了穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）的关注。【原文：The abrupt changeover in leadership at the Chicago Board of Education has caught the attention of Moody’s Ratings, which said analysts are monitoring the situation amid mounting financial challenges for the school district.】

item.title: 派拉蒙联席首席执行官即使不是老板也能拿钱
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司的三位联席首席执行官无论是否继续担任首席执行官，都将继续领取他们在影视公司任职期间提高的年度现金分红。【原文：Paramount Global’s three co-chief executive officers will continue to receive their improved annual cash bonuses while they’re at the film and TV company, whether they stay as CEOs or not.】

item.title: 高通公司称将等待美国大选决定英特尔的去向
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，高通公司可能会等到 11 月美国总统大选之后再决定是否收购英特尔公司。【原文：Qualcomm Inc. is likely to wait until after the US presidential election in November before deciding whether to pursue an offer to buy Intel Corp., people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 印度大亨为债务市场的忠实拥趸带来 98% 的涨幅
item.description:
金属 价格上涨、融资环境改善以及印度对垃圾债投资者的吸引力不断增加，这些都对阿尼尔-阿加瓦尔的韦丹塔公司大有裨益。

但挑战依然存在。【原文：

Rising metal prices, a better financing backdrop and India’s increasing allure for junk-debt investors have all helped Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta. But challenges remain.

item.title: 黄金行业看到金银在一年内激增 10%，创下新纪录
item.description: 一项金银业调查显示，黄金有望在明年再创新高。【原文：Gold is expected to climb to new record highs in the next year, according to a survey of the bullion industry.】

item.title: 申银万国为安排伦敦上市增加更多银行
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，Shein 已经增加了更多的银行来帮助安排其潜在的首次公开募股，这家在线时尚零售商的估值可能达到 500 亿英镑（650 亿美元），有可能成为近年来在伦敦上市的最大公司之一。【原文：Shein has added more banks to help arrange its potential initial public offering that could value the online fashion retailer at £50 billion ($65 billion), potentially one of the biggest listings in London in recent years, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美联航业绩超出预期，摆脱降价压力
item.description: 美国联合航空公司控股公司（United Airlines Holdings Inc.【原文：United Airlines Holdings Inc. reported a third-quarter profit ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in a sign the company is bouncing back from widespread fare discounts that squeezed many carriers this summer.】

item.title: 意大利将在预算计划中向银行和保险公司融资 35 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）的内阁正在利用意大利的银行和保险公司为预算提供资金，这是一项旨在兑现向选民承诺的赠款的新计划。【原文：Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s cabinet is tapping Italy’s banks and insurers to help finance its budget, according to a new plan designed to deliver on giveaways pledged to voters.】

item.title: 阿波罗首席执行官罗文认为私营和公共市场正在融合
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.首席执行官马克-罗文（Marc Rowan）认为，公共市场和私人市场正在融合，后者在华尔街吸引了更多的交易竞争。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Rowan is seeing the public and private markets converging with the latter attracting more competition for trading on Wall Street.】

item.title: PG&E 警告称火灾风险可能导致大范围停电
item.description: PG&E 公司表示，从本周晚些时候开始，预计干燥的大风将席卷加州，届时可能需要对加州大部分地区的家庭和企业断电。【原文：PG&E Corp. said it may need to cut power to homes and businesses across a large portion of California starting later this week when dry, gusty winds are expected to sweep across the state.】

item.title: Meta 难逃国家指控，称其诱导儿童使用平台
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司必须面对数十个州的总检察长提起的诉讼，指控该公司故意让孩子们沉迷于社交媒体，从而助长了青少年心理健康危机。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. must face a lawsuit by dozens of state attorneys general alleging it knowingly contributed to a youth mental health crisis by getting kids hooked on social media.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水患后，英国监管机构考虑提高投资者回报率
item.description: 在泰晤士水务公司的危机推高了整个行业的借贷成本之后，英国水务监管机构首次考虑提高投资者的回报。【原文：The UK water regulator is for the first time considering boosting returns for investors, after the crisis at Thames Water pushed up the cost of borrowing across the industry.】

item.title: 特朗普加密项目网站崩溃，代币开始发售
item.description: 世界自由金融公司（World Liberty Financial）是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）父子推动的一个加密货币项目，该公司在周二开始销售代币时遇到了技术问题。【原文：World Liberty Financial, a crypto project promoted by Donald Trump and his sons, experienced technology issues as it began selling tokens on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言征收更多关税以支持美国经济增长，美元上涨
item.description: 由于前总统唐纳德-特朗普为大幅提高外国进口商品关税的提议辩护，美元攀升至两个月来的最强水平。【原文：The dollar climbed to the strongest level in two months as former President Donald Trump defended proposals to dramatically raise tariffs on foreign imports.】

item.title: 借贷需求增加，波兰出售 30 亿欧元债券
item.description: 波兰重返国际债券市场，出售了 30 亿欧元（33 亿美元）的 7 年期和 15 年期债券，以期在借贷需求激增的情况下获得资金。【原文：Poland returned to the international bond market with a sale of 3 billion euros ($3.3 billion) in seven and 15-year notes in a bid to secure funding amid surging borrowing needs.】

item.title: 汉堡告诉我们有关商业周期的一些信息
item.description: 大家好，欢迎阅读《奇点》时事通讯，它是来自《奇点》世界的每日内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you their thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: S&P的狂飙让华尔街疯狂上调业绩展望
item.description: 华尔街的策略师们急忙调高了对美国股市的预测，因为股市出现了近三十年来最强劲的涨势，一举突破此前的目标，创下历史新高。【原文：Wall Street strategists are rushing to ratchet up their US stock-market forecasts as equities stage the strongest rally in nearly three decades, blowing past previous targets to hit fresh record highs.】

item.title: 马斯克承诺制造大量机器人轴与美国规则相冲突

item.title: 特朗普媒体获得天价估值，赌徒玩转大选
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体创业公司给投资者带来了狂风暴雨，公司价值从 5 月份的最高点跌至 9 月份的最低点，跌幅超过 70 亿美元，然后在不到一个月的时间里又重新获得了 40 亿美元。【原文：Donald Trump’s media startup has taken investors on a wild ride, with the company shedding more than $7 billion in value from its May high to its September bottom, and then regained $4 billion in less than one month.】

item.title: 通胀出人意料地疲软，加拿大大型银行迎来巨额降息
item.description: 在上个月通胀降温幅度超过预期之后，加拿大六家最大的贷款机构中，除了一家之外，目前都预计央行将把借贷成本降低半个百分点。【原文：All but one of Canada’s six biggest lenders now expect the central bank to cut borrowing costs by half a percentage point after inflation cooled by more than expected last month.】

item.title: 警告欧盟天然气公司不要寻求 "危险的 "俄罗斯过境协议
item.description: 欧盟能源专员卡德里-西姆森（Kadri Simson）警告该地区的天然气公司，任何可能达成的让天然气从俄罗斯流经乌克兰的新协议都将是一个 "危险 "的选择。【原文：European Union Energy Commissioner Kadri Simson warned the region’s gas companies that any potential new deals to keep gas flowing from Russia through Ukraine would be a “dangerous” choice.】

item.title: 现金充裕的佛罗里达州首次尝试回购债券
item.description: 佛罗里达州的债券投资者即将做出一个不同寻常的决定：是否将他们的债务卖回给当初发行证券的州政府。【原文：Florida bond investors are about to have an unusual decision to make — whether to sell their debt back to the state that issued the securities in the first place.】
